p:
MICs for Candida strains were determined by the broth microdilution method with RPMI 1640 medium (Sigma Aldrich, Saint Quentin fallavier, France) according to the procedures of the Clinical and Laboratory Standard Institute described in document M27-A2
26 . Yeasts were grown on Sabouraud dextrose agar (Difco Laboratories) at 35 °C for 24 h. The wells were inoculated with 100 µL of the culture suspension diluted to a final inoculum of 5 x 10 2 to 2.5 x 10 3 cells/mL. Fungal growth was observed 48 h after incubation at 35 °C. The MICs of the azoles were the lowest drug concentrations to give a 50% decrease in turbidity from that of the control fungal growth. MIC 90 was the concentration of a drug required at which 90% of the clinical isolates tested were inhibited.
